item.title: 2a Metadata surrogates are inherently arborescent
item.description: Metadata surrogates are the descriptive record which stands in for the “original” item being cataloged. In this case, the “original” item would be the seed and the surrogate would be what grows and branches out from that original item. The surrogate is a representation of the original item. In A Thousand Plateaus, Deleuze and Guattari name arborescence or the model of the tree as the paradigm for knowledge and practice in the modern Western world; in this model, a small ideaâ€”a seed or acornâ€”takes root and grows into a tree with a sturdy trunk supporting numerous branches, all linked to and traceable back to the original seed.

item.title: 2a1 Metadata surrogates are the tree trunk instead of the end of a branch
item.description: When constructed by others in order to exploit us, the metadata surrogates of ourselves are the seed or original instead of being the thing that grows from and represents the original item. parent 2a Metadata surrogates are inherently arborescent
